data.title: Disguised spy shows wrong pip color to enemies with GPS
data.body: This makes GPS a solid counter to Spy. Should this be?

data.title: Armor type for APC is unrealistic
data.body: Both demo trucks/ atomic bombs have little effect on APCs health armor. They can survive a direct blast from a nuke.

data.title: Desert terrain for RA by Harisson
data.body:
This adds the high quality desert terrain expansion for Red Alert. http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=83&p=279353#279353 It's the cnc desert terrain converted to RA. Missing tiles were hand-drawn. I fixed the remaining issues mostly related to the palette rotation system. The exceptions I added do not break anything and make sense in general. However I have not backported them to the editor yet which handles palettes somehow different.

PS: Added the PlayerPalette definition to the OpenRA.Editor.exe, too.

data.title: Edit the map.yaml in OpenRA.Editor
data.body: You currently have to unzip your .oramap file, open the map.yaml with a decent editor that allows tabs being handled as tabs (this seems to be a problem for Windows users) and zip it again. Just exposing the map.yaml via the editor using a button with "expert options" might ease the creation of maps that mod the game.

data.title: better documentation for modders
data.body:
I don't know if this is required after all. People seem to be able to mod the game without any manual at all. The idea is to auto-generate something like https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Trait-Documentation or maybe create a manual to be shipped with each release.

https://github.com/chrisforbes/OpenRA/tree/radoc is a work in progress for automated trait documentation with comments stored inside the source code using `[Desc("String")]` and compile it into the game.

`OpenRA.Utility.exe --doc` will then output something like http://sprunge.us/faLe To be adjusted to wiki markdown or docbook (and then create a HTML, CHM or PDF file).

data.title: RedAlert requests: Building bib, donate, medic, zoom, etc...
data.body:
The small patch of dirt/cement infront of nearly every building in the game. Remove it from all but what is necessary. So take it off every building except: Refinery, Barracks, and War Factory. They serve no purpose and really get in the way on small maps. 

A command to "donate" a building to an ally. IE: Donate them a Construction Yard after they lose theirs. Shouldn't work for super weapons or side specific buildings. So we cant have allies given an airfield or soviets given a Chronosphere. Donated MCV's should change to whatever team the player they were given to are. Allied MCV donated to Soviet player>MCV is now soviet.

Give medic a special mode (IE: Hitting  Z sets it into MEDIC mode, not on by default.) that will make them run around healing all nearby friendly infantry, return to starting position when no more to heal. On that thought maybe give units a small icon when they aren't set at their default stance? 
Shield for defend etc... Or just put a 1,2,3 and we just need to remember what mode each number is. IE: 1=Defend 2=Attack 3=Do Nothing
Same for mechanic when introduced. 

"Enable Pixel Doubling" should be removed and either one option chosen for all players, or allow zooming in/out with the scroll wheel. People who don't use it have an advantage over those that do. Personally I don't like being zoomed out that much.

Auto power down select buildings when low power. When low power automatically power down low priority structures. You are likely under attack so you will want base defenses but super weapons will not be necessary. So have it auto power down buildings until base defenses are operational, more important for soviets I guess. Building priority(what to power down first) would be Superweapons>Radar>AA Defenses(check for areas covered by multiple defenses and power down unnecessary ones till equilibrium or continue to next item)>Base defenses(Check for nearby enemy units/area covered by another defense)
At that point not much else can be done, the player can manually power on/off stuff as needed. Power should be restored in the opposite manner as new power is created. 

Some kind of check to prevent base walking. (IE: 3 buildings in a row with no offshoots shouldn't allow farther construction in that direction.) A cheaper solution would be to not allow cheap buildings to be constructed more then 3 in a row? IE: PowerPlant>Airfield>Helipad>XXXX Cannot build more in that direction. Defensive buildings do not count as offshoots. Could probably easily trick the check so this would need a lot more thought put into it. 

Add check to make attacking units try to stay out of range of base defenses whenever possible.

Add check for units to decide if the current path is blocked, will going another way take longer? IE: Going over a bridge and the bridge is full but the units on it are moving, will waiting for them to finish crossing or going around be better?

Just throwing out ideas, don't hate me if one is stupid.

data.title: (Pseudo)-fullscreen spreads over both screens when using dual-head
data.body:
I am using a dual-head setup of my laptop and an external 1080p screen.  With the external screen connected OpenRA spreads over both screens (with both pseudo- and normal full screen mode).
This results in the menu being split up by the rims of both screens, etc.  I prefer to play on the main head in full screen only.

data.title: Allies: Fix crash when spectators are present
fix #2425; Bots should be removed when switching to a map which doesn't allow them
Volkov does not shoot from Pillbox
Allow installation of mods in home folders
data.body: As users develop mods that are not shipped with mainline OpenRA, there should be a folder for mods  in $HOME. This is especially important for Linux users who need root permission to access /usr/share. Also the map folder in $HOME should be advertised more.

data.title: Bots should be removed when switching to a map which doesn't allow them
data.body:
Bots should be removed when switching to a map which doesn't allow them (with AllowBots: False). You can switch to a map which allows bots, place a bot in the second slot and then switch back to a map which does not allow bots (such as Allies 02).

AllowBots: False only currently blocks bot slot placements while we're actually on the blocking map.

data.title: Finish EmitCargoOnSell
data.body: This trait still has work to be done. Right now the pbox/hbox are using EmitInfantryOnSell, which is not doing what we want it to; these structures should evac their cargo when sold (if any).

data.title: -- add ice tile entries to sequences.yaml
data.body: fixes crashes on maps using these ice tiles.

data.title: Tesla doesn't respect weapon offset
Add advanced game options
data.body:
So here is my updated idea now that i have thought for more than 5 minutes :P

 I think it would be awesome to add some advanced game options when creating a multiplayer game to modify the game your hosting to meet your needs.

So there could be an advanced game options panel that allows you to:
Toggle Inf on/off
Toggle Vehicles on/off
Toggle Air
Toggle Crates
enable crushing of infantry (i really would like this :3)
changing of starting funds
game speed
No super weapons
no rush
etc

change game ruleset e.g. have the option to play the C&C mod with the new OpenRA balancing or the Classic C&C balancing

Of course i don't demand in anyway that all these be done but i believe its a great idea and will allow for a bit of flexibility and fun in game :)
